Posts.Content: Cialis initially worked for me as prescribed for mild BPH however even though its early post-op I dont believe it is doing anything after RALP. Switched to sildenafil and insurance covers it. Obtain 60 pills 20mg from Costco for $10.00 co-pay. As of yet, no noted improvement but as mentioned still early.
Posts.Title: Wondering about the effectiveness of Trimix

Posts.Content: Even with my PSA test results my URO is firm. Continue testing every 3 months for first year and if readings hold then move to 6 month testing for the second year. If at the end of 2nd year nothing changes then go annual on 3rd year for the duration. So be it.....
Posts.Title: Am I Cured?

Posts.Content: Even with my PSA test results my URO is firm. Continue testing every 3 months for first year and if readings hold then move to 6 month testing for the second year. If at the end of 2nd year nothing changes then go annual on 3rd year for the duration. So be it.....
Posts.Title: Am I Cured?

Posts.Content: Walked prior to surgery @ 3 miles per day. After surgery began walking again immediately after BM on day 4 after release. Started kegel about one month prior to surgery and continued until around a month post surgery. Now walking from 3 to 6 miles daily. Total night time continence upon release from hospital to present. Struggled with incontinence for first two weeks but the most Depend Guards used was 4 to 5 with number reducing as weeks went by until around week 8 at which time things improved greatly. Week 8 was using only Depend Shields for light dribbles and on exact day of week 12 post surgery went the whole day without wetting the Shield. Used Depend Briefs only for night time and still do even though no problems as noted, just a confidence issue. Primarily used Depend Guards (have boxes leftover) and Depend Shields. Right now using one Shield per day and most nights they are removed dry. Fortunately for me physical therapy isn't an issue. Judge myself 99.0 continent. Regards.
Posts.Title: Poll question: post Prostatechtomy

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by bigalcalbisque Consult1, as we are just days apart in this process, I can't give you much to go by, however when I talked to my Physical Therapist and gave him my exact incontinence issues, he felt that Physical Therapy probably wouldn't be that much more beneficial to me, he said to keep up with the Kegels which I am and am starting to notice a bit more control in the last week. As a reference point from the day my Cathy was removed until just recently, I used 1 small pad in the day that got about 1/2 soaked and 1 pad at night that would usually only have a few dribbles in it and only twice was it soaked, I never had any problems with the sheets getting wet. Now, it has changed for the positive as when I get that weird feeling just before I squirt onto the pad, when I do get that feeling I can stop it about 70% of the time and get to the toilet in time, even if I am in a store or my car for about 10 minutes. So I feel improvement just with the Kegels, again just recently. I hope that helps a little, BTW: what exercises is your Physical Therapist making you do? Once you know what they are, can't you just do them at home? Al Get "weird feeling" also, feels like I am about to leak however pad is always dry. Feeling, I believe for me is bladder "telling" me time to empty. And, exactly as you described time wise. While I do not worry about leakage I can still assure you that I know the location of all public restrooms in my local area. Respectfully.

Posts.Title: Red spots showing up on his skin

Posts.Content: Just posted the results from my 6 month PSA test taken yesterday. Posted as < .010 , so post-op at 6 weeks, 3 months and now 6 months have registered the same. Will be interesting to heard URO thoughts on my appointment this coming Monday. Think I'll be heading to the movies and out with wife this weekend. God bless all brothers, sisters and companions on this journey.
Posts.Title: 6th month post-op PSA

Posts.Content: Congrats! We have very similar stats and I have the same concerns as far as where do we go with this. Have one year appt with URO and if PSA is undetectable we move to 6 month testing. I know others will say I should at least be talking with RO due to pT3b. Just always a decision. Again, congratulations and take care.
Posts.Title: Sor Far, So Good

Posts.Content: Congratulations to you. I also completed SRT on Thursday. My experience parallels yours pretty much to a tee! Just a marathon. Like you my only noticeable SE was minor fatigue in last couple of weeks and no urinary or rectal issues. RO made exact same commit about SE in that he doubted there would be any if I hadnt developed any during treatment. My team was located at the Banner MDA Cancer Center in Greeley CO. I have 2 more months of Firmagon to complete my 6 months. Only issue with ADT is minor night time hot flashes which are nothing. Like you follow up in 3 months. Again, congratulations!!!
Posts.Title: Completed SRT

Posts.Content: Pretty much describes my situation and experiences to date. So, believe me you are certainly not alone. However, in my case I thought earlier on that nerves were recovering but like so many issues that proved to be a curve ball as at 1 year it is 100 % ED for me. Tried PDE5s, VED and Trimix with erection success with VED and Trimix but wife isnt, how would I say it, overly interested or willing to actively participate. So no you are not alone.
Posts.Title: Happy Anniversary

Posts.Content: I have found that COSTCO has very reasonable prices.
Posts.Title: Sildenafil

Posts.Content: Today is exactly 19 weeks post operative for me. For the most part, I can honestly state that I am progressing extremely well in recovery. Never any pain or problems worth mentioning. Incision scars are only noticeable when viewed, if not looking I don't know where they are from feel alone. I had a lot of discomfort with continence first couple of weeks; however, by 8th week was into light day Shields and by 12th week one Shield per day with dry at shower time. Now sleeping in jockeys with a Shield and no leakage at all. Over weekend, got up and immediately started on "honey-do's" and didn't think about pad. Unfortunately, ended up wearing same pad from previous night all that day with no drips or dribbles. My biggest issue at this time is ED. Like you, I experienced slight arousal early which didn't last long, but did provide hope. Was taking Cialis and recently switched to Sildenafil and with suggestion from URO purchased a VED for enhanced blood flow. Recently, had intercourse, first about 5 days ago through use of PDE5 combined with VED. I did not climax; however, it was successful enough that wife did! And, believe me it was a great boost to my psyche/ego..! Night before last we decided to help my healing again, took 20mg sildenafil and pumped away. This time, we both climaxed. You don't know what a difference that makes. I know I am not anywhere near healed and nerves are still recovering from trauma but I never have given up. Am I happy with silldenafil and VED? Not entirely but they work and I have hope for much more improvement. Have opened dialogue with URO about using BiMix gel to see where that goes. I just mention this help show that patience is the key along with hope. Don't get frustrated nor give up hope. Take care.
Posts.Title: ED.....Patience??....Feeling a tad useless down there

Posts.Content: I have found that COSTCO has very reasonable prices.

Posts.Title: ED.....Patience??....Feeling a tad useless down there

Posts.Content: Had first PSA post-op at 6 week point on Sept 19th which came back < .010 ng/mL and had 3 month check yesterday, Nov 01, and it also came back as < .010ng/mL!! Very good news which really made my day. Additionally, on the exact day of 12 weeks post-op I went ALL day with 1 light day pad which stayed completely dry! As support to other comments I have read I noted significant improvement on continence during the 8th week with improvements in control up to this date. Never had issue during night time and now believe I am 99% back in "control." Have appointment with URO next Monday which should be interesting with PSA results and bladder control. Alas, no rise from Wee Willie at this point but haven't given up hope on that at this time. Staying positive - #1 - Cure #2 - Continence #3 - Potency. In that order.....! Best wishes to all and God bless to all. I will be lurking in the background. V/R
Posts.Title: Month 3 PSA Results

Posts.Content: Had blood draw this morning (09/19/17) for first post op PSA and just reviewed the results which were less than .010ng/mL. At this time Uro and I have agreed to another check in 6 weeks followed by another shortly before next appointment in mid December. At that time will have additional information for next step, adjuvant alone or adjuvant with HT. Overall, I believe finally some good news. God bless.
Posts.Title: 6 Week Post-Op PSA results

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by garyi Why are you considering adjuvant, with or without HT, given your excellent .010ng/mL PSA??? I don't get it. Hope you keep doing well. My 8 week post PSA just came back. It's .32ng/mL. Not such good news. Agree. Believe it would have been better to state, "....adjuvant with HT, as/if necessary." While not nearly as educated as most on the forum on PCa issues, involvement of intraductal and SVI, from my prospective seems to make it a good idea to come to terms with the possibility that these treatments could be in my future. Not being negative just "looking down the road." Noted with EPE also; however, it being noted as focal gives me hope that it doesn't become a major player. Into 7th week post-op and basically using one shield/guard a day. Dry at night, new guard in morning and dispose at shower time. Taking 5mg Cialis every other day with fingers crossed. Sorry to see your results, stay strong and positive. Early June, '17, I was hospitalized with both C. Diff and E. Coli, went sepsis. Take care.
Posts.Title: 6 Week Post-Op PSA results

Posts.Content: When my surgeon called about initial results of final diagnosis after RALP he mentioned sending off samples for Deciper genomic testing. This is basically what I have found out about this. It is for predicting the probability of metastasis after surgery and provides an independent assessment of tumor aggressiveness; information distinct from that provided by Gleason score or PSA. Is anyone familiar with this deciper testing program?? TKS
Posts.Title: New Question - Decipher

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Michael F Hi IS! Not sure why your updated "Signature" has not automatically updated across all of your posts?!?! Your Path Report places you an elevated intermediate risk status based on findings of: - Gleason (4+3) with 80% Pattern 4 - Tertiary Pattern 5 - Seminal Vesicle Involvement - PNI = "extensive" You can go to the GenomeDX website in plug in your post RP Path Report data and then receive a response http://deciphertest.com/patients/is-...-right-for-me/ I would schedule an appointment with the URO Surgeon to review his/her intraoperative surgical findings & the Path Report findings. Have the MD determine your risk for recurrence. Then ask "What additional beneficial info or value can/will 'Decipher' provide?' Most importantly you will need to monitor your PSA at regular intervals. Since your risk status is elevated, discuss with your URO Surgeon the need to monitor with an Ultrasensitive PSA (uPSAMethodology. This can detect a clinically significant rising PSA early. In order to compare results, you must have the uPSA analyzed at The Same Lab using The Same uPSA Methodology each time. Please keep The Forum educated by providing your URO Surgeon's suggestions. Good luck! MF Thank you for the followup. Sorry it's taken a while to get back as yesterday I had the catheter removed and was miserable all day. Rough night but managed to keep everything dry. That little dribble is driving me crazy! As does everyone I have been reading and considering options and am kind of settling into what I, uneducated as I am, will discuss with URO. I have to get the formal path followup appointment scheduled as I was scheduled early for RP (08/08/17) as that was his last week prior to his being out for two weeks (wife due). That would have been 3 additional weeks and he didn't want me to wait. That Friday afternoon he called me after following up with pathologist on findings and he wanted me to know. At this time, he mentioned Decipher for additional info in determination of course of action and appointment with RO to begin workup for ART. My thoughts now basically are discussion with URO on specifics of path findings/report, get scheduled for visit with RO (with whom I have already discussed my case and he had accepted me for RT(VMAT)/brachytherapy/ADT) prior to surgery decision, wait until @ 6 weeks after surgery for initial post PSA blood draw. Hopefully, I can use a few more weeks for urinary rehabilitation. I believe at this time regardless of PSA that I am strongly leaning towards ART with hopes of avoiding ADT. With the SVI, believe hitting area with ART in near term is better than waiting to commence SRT if needed. Does this seem logical?
Posts.Title: New Question - Decipher

Posts.Content: Congratulations! Wishing you years of great results.

Posts.Content: Just added my data to my signature as provided some other informational details on earlier thread. If anyone would care to review and pass on any insightful comments or hints they would be most appreciated. At present, after 13 days tomorrow I get my tube removed. Await initial post PSA testing and sending off samples for Deciper genomic testing. Surgeon already brought up a short course of RT (22 - 25) to address SVI. Have further discussions scheduled so any issues I need to bring up would be helpful.. Tks and regards to all.

Posts.Content: Congratulations on your results! My .018 went to .021 so now doing every 30 day uPSA. Even at these low levels I have already had discussion with RO.

Even with reclining seat it helpled relieve abdominal pressure. And, I was told I could not drive until after catheter removal at the earliest. Know Kerrville and the foothills well. Wishing and hoping for the best! V/R

Posts.Title: The Drive Home

Posts.Content: Jeff, your report is very similar to mine with exception being I was downgraded from 4 + 5 to 4 + 3 with overall involvement of 25 percent. Also, "hit" with SVI (left) and EPE (focal); however, also have clear margins. I had thoughts of possible ART due to T3b and discussed issue with URO about meeting with RO and at this point we are "holding" further action as I have had both a 6 week and 3 month post-op PSA with both < .010 and my 6 month test is in 2 weeks, so waiting those results. Like you, I am weighing everything very closely and will proceed to ART if necessary. As far as continence, just shy of 6 months and I would rate myself 99.9 percent continent. Take care.

Posts.Title: Seminal vesicles spread

Posts.Content: Find myself in the same situation as review of my signature will indicate. I requested uPSA from the on-set in order to identify any activity at an early stage with intent of hitting it early and not wait for the .2 standard. I was fortunate to go 9 months with undetectable (<.010) readings,then somewhere between 9 and 12 months I presented with detectable. Even at extremely low levels, I have been told that I present with an example case of BCR. The initial undetectable months lead to ruling out residual matter or other source PSA and the steady rise shows growth. After the initial detectable of .018, I requested monthly checks in order obtain data points for PSA activity. The subsequent readings (.021, .028 and .031) provided the necessary data to drive action. My feelings were and are that if/when I hit the magical .03 level I would "pull the trigger" on SRT. With my pathology I view it as being unreasonable to wait and would be going against the very reason for having uPSAs. I had meeting with both my URO and RO with both agreeing RT and that the decision of ADT was my call to make. I just met with them for their input to see how it matched with my thoughts. I had already decided on 6 months ADT (Firmagon) and RT. My thoughts on ADT were exactly as yours, 6 months now or "what if" scenario and years of ADT if RT alone did not achieve success. Yes, even though if tested using a standard PSA I would still be <.1, I am still proceeding with SRT as that's what the uPSA was for. Advance identification of BCR and to hit it hard at around .03. I am scheduled for initial dose of Firmagon on December 7th, and will be meeting with RO to discuss my treatment plan and schedule simulation. RO stated treatment would be using IMRT. I contacted my URO office today and requested they submit order for one more uPSA with testosterone measurement to establish a baseline data point so plan on blood draw on Wednesday with Firmagon injections on Friday. Requested Friday in order to give myself the weekend, if needed, to stabilize physical well-being. Best wishes to all.
Posts.Title: Heading for SRT

Posts.Content: Another T3b - Thinking along with RobLee...!

Like you, I am weighing everything very closely and will proceed to ART if necessary. As far as continence, just shy of 6 months and I would rate myself 99.9 percent continent. Take care.
Posts.Title: Day 11, post RALP with pathologic data

Posts.Content: Also noted with intraductal (IDCP), see signature. PSA prior to surgery was 7.2 and have not obtained a 6 week post-op reading (draw this coming week). Just wondering, are the terms "ductal" and "intraductal" addressing the same issue? Based on my SVI alone believe I am looking at adjuvant IR at a minimum and am hoping to avoid ADT at this time. Regardless of post-op PSA believe I am visiting with RO in very near future. Have RO in mind as met with him prior to final decision to go with RALP. Keep posting on status. Regards
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with Ductal Prostate Cancer

Posts.Title: Diagnosed with Ductal Prostate Cancer

Posts.Content: RALP 08/08. Catheter out 08/21. When removed inserted 120cc fluid, voided 175cc, urine no blood. Other than incontinence no urinary issues. Started Cialis (5mg) 09/10 every other day, have taken prior for BPH with no SEs noted. Shortly after beginning for rehab noted funny tingly feeling in penis then began to note a very light pinkish tint to urine. Last night, experienced an episode of nocturnal emission or more commonly known as a "wet dream" obviously without fluid. At least my memory of such things isn't too foggy as it was as I remember prior to surgery sensations and all. I awoke immediately afterward as was usual, "Wee Wille" wasn't intercourse hard there was an obvious half staff. This morning I noted more of a reddish tint to urine and later noted darker. Worked outside (light) and drank plenty of water so it seems now urine is back to normal. Question if anyone has experienced this sort of issue while healing. My hope is "something" is at least trying to function and that this is a good sign. Additionally, received Decipher results which scored me as being an "Avg Risk" with risk at RP - Percent Likelihood 5-Year Metastasis 7.8% 10-Year Prostate Cancer Specific Mortality 7.1% Scheduled for 6 week post-op PSA draw this Wednesday, then another 6 weeks following initial and one immediately prior to 3 month doctor visit in December. Keeping fingers crossed. God Bless to all brothers and sisters..!
Posts.Title: Nocturnal Emission - ED

Posts.Content: Just information which those in the northern Colorado region may be interested in. This past Thursday (08/30/201 the establishment of Banner MD Anderson Cancer Centers was announced. Banner Health affiliates with MD Anderson Cancer Center will be Banner hospitals located in Loveland and Greeley. So, more treatment location options and less travel out of state for those of us in northern Colorado. Thank you.
Posts.Title: MD Anderson affiliates

Posts.Content: DD best wishes to you and your loved ones and to all forum brothers and sisters this holiday season. May the coming year be a blessed one for all!

Posts.Content: Never attempted through insurance but believe with a medical necessity statement and script from your doctor you would stand an excellent chance for approval. I just paid $125.00 for my Encore Deluxe and am quite pleased.

Posts.Content: Just received my second Firmagon injection with simm for IMRT this Wednesday. PSA on Dec 5th was .025 so .03 previous month noted as .031. My thoughts have always been to hit it hard once BCR present and my decision to hit it at .03.

Posts.Content: Just wanted to post that the results for my 9 month post-op PSA came back as < .010 again. That means 6 week, 3 month, 6 month and now 9th month have all been the same. Also, stopped wearing any shields about a month ago and am 100 percent continent! Additional plus, woke up this a.m. with a half woodie, not good for anything but a positive sign which I will gladly accept. Blessings to all.
